From eight PM American public media this is performance today I'm Fred Child taking you to concerts around the world
Violinist Paul song plays a lot of concerts over the course of the year and that means he spends a lot of time practicing as well or polls long recently told me that when he practices he starts off playing just the open strings of the violin
Well I had to ask what was he listening for with that kind of practice why play just the open strings
First thing is to hear the vibrations of the woods in the south and second thing is not only just for my own benefits of warming up but also warming up the violin as well so you want it to warm up slowly nicely as well so I think open string is to most neutral and
Most um easiest way and in the in the way I find that to be very cleansing and it's very healthy I think for the instrument as well
I Love that we usually think about musicians warming up working out the kinks stretching out muscled physically and mentally getting primed to play we don't usually think about the instrument needing to warm up too but it needs to ease into playing as well [noise]
